title: Polynomial Zeros - finding possible linear factors

content.question: ​The polynomial function is given by <math alttext="p open parentheses x close parentheses equals open parentheses x minus 3 close parentheses to the power of 7 open parentheses x plus 2 close parentheses to the power of 5 open parentheses x squared plus a x plus 9 close parentheses"><mi>p</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msup><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced><mn>7</mn></msup><msup><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced><mn>5</mn></msup><mfenced><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>, where <math alttext="a"><mi>a</mi></math> is an integer. For <math alttext="p"><mi>p</mi></math>, which of the following statements is true about the multiplicity of the zero <math alttext="x equals 3"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math> ?

choices.label: ​The multiplicity must be <math alttext="7"><mn>7</mn></math>, because the exponent on the factor <math alttext="open parentheses x minus 3 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced></math> is <math alttext="7"><mn>7</mn></math>.

​The multiplicity can be <math alttext="8"><mn>8</mn></math>, because the exponent on the factor <math alttext="open parentheses x minus 3 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced></math> is <math alttext="7"><mn>7</mn></math>, and <math alttext="x equals 3"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math> is a zero of <math alttext="open parentheses x squared plus 0 x plus 9 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>0</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></mfenced></math> with multiplicity <math alttext="1"><mn>1</mn></math>.

​The multiplicity can be <math alttext="9"><mn>9</mn></math>, because the exponent on the factor <math alttext="open parentheses x minus 3 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced></math> is <math alttext="7"><mn>7</mn></math>, and <math alttext="x equals 3"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math> is a zero of <math alttext="open parentheses x squared plus 6 x plus 9 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></mfenced></math> with multiplicity <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math>.

​The multiplicity can be <math alttext="9"><mn>9</mn></math>, because the exponent on the factor <math alttext="open parentheses x minus 3 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced></math> is <math alttext="7"><mn>7</mn></math>, and <math alttext="x equals 3"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math> is a zero of <math alttext="open parentheses x squared minus 6 x plus 9 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></mfenced></math> with multiplicity <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math>.

content.answer: ​The multiplicity can be <math alttext="9"><mn>9</mn></math>, because the exponent on the factor <math alttext="open parentheses x minus 3 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced></math> is <math alttext="7"><mn>7</mn></math>, and <math alttext="x equals 3"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math> is a zero of <math alttext="open parentheses x squared minus 6 x plus 9 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></mfenced></math> with multiplicity <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math>.

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Support conclusions or choices with a logical rationale or appropriate data.
